bill_title: repeal the regulation of boat dealers.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to repeal the regulation of boat dealers. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 32-7B-1 be repealed. 32-7B-1. For the purposes of this chapter, a boat dealer is any person who, for commission or with intent to make a profit or gain, sells, exchanges, rents, or leases with option to purchase, offers or attempts to negotiate a sale or exchange of new or used boats as defined in chapter 42-8, or who is engaged wholly or in part in the business of selling new or used boats. Section 2. That § 32-7B-2 be repealed. 32-7B-2. No person may engage in the business of selling, or may offer to sell, display, act as a broker, or advertise the sale of new or used boats, without a license as provided in this chapter. Any violation of this section is a Class 1 misdemeanor. Section 3. That § § 32-7B-3 to 32-7B-30, inclusive, be repealed. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
